intro: Auerodendron reticulatum, commonly known as the net-veined tree, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves with a complex network of veins. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. The bark and leaves of Auerodendron reticulatum have been used in traditional medicine for various purposes.
